meanings.definition: The state or quality of being viscous or sticky.
meanings.sent1: The viscidities of the glue made it hard to separate the papers.
meanings.sent2: The viscidities of the honey caused it to slowly drip off the spoon.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy got into a mess with the viscidities of the bubblegum.
meanings.sent4: The relationship between the two characters had a certain viscidities that kept them close.
meanings.sent5: The viscidities of the mud made it difficult for the hikers to move forward.

meanings.definition: The tendency to adhere or cling together.
meanings.sent1: The viscidities of the tape made it stick firmly to the wall.
meanings.sent2: The viscidities of the magnets caused them to attract each other.
meanings.sent3: The viscidities of the siblings made them inseparable.
meanings.sent4: The viscidities of the gossip in the small town spread quickly.
meanings.sent5: The viscidities of the spider's web caught unsuspecting insects.
